page.title: 04VILLAGE OF BUTLERS MARSTON.
page.content: On the eastern edge of the "D Block" the village of Butlers Marston is near the small river Dene in an open, well-wooded landscape.The village straddles the Kineton road (B4451), itself constructed in 1771,and most of the old stone cottages date from about this period.A similar size to Combrook,more and more new houses and bungalows are being built around its edges.The Gothic style Victorian school is worthy of note.ALso of interest is the total absence of a public house.Slightly away from the village is the manor house and the parish church of St. Peter and St. Paul.Originally Norman the church now mainly dates from 1872.However fine Norman stonework is to be found in the solid round piers of the south arcade. Population and employment follows the same pattern as Combrook.
